title: U.S. Department of Energy Awards Team Led by Ginkgo Bioworks Funding to Develop Algal Crop Protection Solutions - PR Newswire
summary: The U.S. Department of Energy has awarded a team led by Ginkgo Bioworks funding to develop environmentally-friendly algal crop protection solutions. The project aims to improve algal biotechnology to increase the production of biofuels and bioproducts from atmospheric CO2. The team will develop new algal pest-specific antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) and use adaptive laboratory evolution (ALE) to increase the tolerance of algae to AMP treatment.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the project aims to develop environmentally-friendly algal crop protection solutions and improve algal biotechnology to increase the production of biofuels and bioproducts from atmospheric CO2.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the project aims to develop new algal pest-specific antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) and use adaptive laboratory evolution (ALE) to increase the tolerance of algae to AMP treatment, which has the potential to improve the efficiency and productivity of algal biotechnologies.
green_product: TRUE, as the project aims to develop environmentally-friendly algal crop protection solutions, which would reduce the need for traditional chemical pesticides.
green_process: TRUE, as the project aims to develop new algal pest-specific antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) and use adaptive laboratory evolution (ALE) to increase the tolerance of algae to AMP treatment, which could be a more environmentally-friendly and efficient process than using traditional chemical pesticides.

title: Unprecedented solar and storage growth on horizon with record installations and investments in U.S. - pv magazine International
summary: The United States is experiencing a renewable energy revolution, driven by environmental concerns, economic opportunities, and technological advancements. The Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) and Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) are accelerating the transition to clean energy, with significant investments in solar PV manufacturing, energy storage, and clean energy jobs. The solar and energy storage sectors are experiencing rapid growth, with the US poised to make its largest-ever addition to PV capacity in 2023.

green_product: TRUE. The article refers to solar PV panels and energy storage batteries as green products because they are designed and manufactured to minimize their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, using environmentally friendly materials and processes.
green_process: TRUE. The article mentions that green processes are used in the manufacturing of solar PV panels and energy storage batteries, which involve the use of renewable resources, recycling of materials, and energy-efficient technologies.

title: The EU wants to put a tax on emissions from imports. It's irked some other nations at COP28 - The Associated Press
summary: The European Union's proposed Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) has sparked debate at the COP28 climate conference in Dubai, with poorer countries fearing that such tariffs will harm livelihoods and economic growth. While wealthier countries see the tax as a way to reduce emissions from imports and create a level-playing field for goods made in the European bloc that must meet stricter green standards, developing countries worry that it will harm their economies and make it too expensive to trade with the bloc. The EU insists that the tax is crucial for funding and achieving its climate goal of slashing emissions 55% by 2030.

title: How did the top smartphone makers fare in sustainability in 2023? - Rappler
summary: Smartphone manufacturers are increasingly focused on sustainability, with many companies making commitments to reduce their carbon emissions and use more recycled materials. title: Millennium Welt, Gentari break ground on EV charging flagship store - theSun
summary: Millennium Welt and Gentari Malaysia have broken ground on their first EV Charging Flagship Store in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The store will offer a first-of-its-kind concept for electric vehicle charging in Southeast Asia, with 14 EV charging points, including high-speed 240kW DC chargers and AC chargers, and an experience hub for customers. The store will be powered completely by renewable energy sources and will house a display area for 66 electric vehicles.

business_innovation: TRUE, as the EV Charging Flagship Store is a new and improved business process for charging electric vehicles that differs significantly from previous methods of charging.
green_product: TRUE, as the EV Charging Flagship Store will offer electric vehicles that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, as the EV Charging Flagship Store will use renewable energy sources and implement waste reduction and energy-efficient technologies in its operations.

title: BMW and Gentari join hands for EV Charging Flagship Store in Jalan Kuching - ZigWheels Malaysia
summary: BMW Group Malaysia and Gentari Malaysia are collaborating to open an EV Charging Flagship Store in Jalan Kuching, Malaysia. The store will be a hub for firsthand experiences of future mobility, with a display space for 66 cutting-edge electric vehicles, six 240kW DC Chargers, and two 22kW AC Chargers. The store will also offer customers a premium ownership experience of electrified BMW vehicles with BMW’s Retail.Next ambience and integrated services.

title: NWTN Announces Strategic Partnership with China State Construction Engineering Corporation (Middle East) - PR Newswire
summary: NWTN Inc. and China State Construction Engineering Corporation (Middle East) LLC (CSCEC) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to collaborate on the development of new energy vehicles and green hydrogen projects.
